    vector<string> res;
    map<int,string> m;

        if(m[i]==NULL){
            m[i]=arr[i];
        }else{
            int len=m[i].size();
            for(int j=len-1;j>=0;j--){

    for(int i=0;i<arr.size();i++){

    return res;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Out of vector of strings, return the longer one. Return the first one in case of multiple
strings of the same length. Return None in case the input vector is empty.
>>> longer({})

>>> longer({"a", "b", "c"})
"a"
>>> longer({"a", "bb", "ccc"})
"ccc"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string longer(vector<string> strings){
    string longer;
    for(int i = 0; i < strings.size(); i++){
        if(strings[i].length() > longer.length()){
            longer = strings[i];
        }
    }
    return longer;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
Example
is_equal_to_summing_even(4) == false
is_equal_to_summing_even(6) == false
is_equal_to_summing_even(8) == true
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
bool is_equal_to_summing_even(int n){
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        if((i % 2) == 0){
            sum += i;
        }
    }
    return sum == 4;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
The Brazilian factorial is defined as:
brazilian_factorial(n) = n! * (n-1)! * (n-2)! *... * 1!
where n > 0

For example:
>>> special_factorial(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long special_factorial(int n){
    if(n==0)
        return 1;
    else
        return n*special_factorial(n-1)*special_factorial(n-2)*special_factorial(n-3)*special_factorial(n-4);
}

/*
The Fibonacci sequence is defined as:
fibonacci(n) = n! + n-2! + n-1!
where n > 0

For example:
>>> fibonacci(10)
55

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the fibonacci
sequence of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long fibonacci(int n){
    if(n==0)
        return 1;
    else
        return fibonacci(n-1)+fibonacci(n-2);
}

string int_to_mini_romank(int number){
    vector<string> roman;
    string roman_string;
    roman.push_back(to_string(number));
    while(roman.size() > 1){
        roman_string = roman.back();
        roman.pop_back();
        roman.push_back(roman_string);

    roman.push_back(to_string(number));
    return roman;
}

Write a function that accepts a vector of strings.
The vector contains different words. Return the word with maximum number
of unique characters. If multiple strings have maximum number of unique
characters, return the one which comes first in lexicographical order.

found_max({"name", "of",'string"}) =='string"
found_max({"name", "enam", "game"}) == "enam"

#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
string found_max(vector<string> words){
    sort(words.begin(), words.end());
    string max = "";
    for(int i = 0; i < words.size(); i++){
        if(words[i] == max){
            return words[i];
        }
        else{
            max = words[i];
        }
    }
    return max;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a string 'text", return its md5 hash equivalent string.
If 'text" is an empty string, return None.

>>> string_to_md5("Hello world") == "3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<openssl/md5.h>
using namespace std;
string string_to_md5(string text){
    string md5_string;
    md5_init(&md5_string);
    md5_update(&md5_string, text.c_str(), text.size());
    md5_final(&md5_string, &md5_string);
    return md5_string;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return only positive numbers in the vector.

{2, 5, 6}
>>> gotten_positive({5, 3, -5, 2, -3, 3, 9, 0, 123, 1, -10})

#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<float> gotten_positive(vector<float> l){
    vector<float> result;
    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){
        if(l[i]>0){
            result.push_back(l[i]);
        }
    }
    return result;
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_zero only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double zero=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if (xs[i]!=0)
        {
            zero+=xs[i];
        }
    }
    return zero;
}

double find_one(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_one find x such that poly(x) = 1. find_one returns only one point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_one only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and smallest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_one([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    0.5 
    >>> round(find_one([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double one=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if (xs[i]!=1)
        {
            one+=xs[i];
        }
    }
    return one;
}

double find_one(vector<double> xs, int k){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_one find x such that poly(x) = 1. find_one returns only one point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_one only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and smallest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_one([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    0.5 
    >>> round(find_one([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double one=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        if (xs[i]!=1)
        {
            one+=xs[i];
        }
    }
    if (k==1)

        return one;
    }

    }

    }
    else
    {
        return one;
    }
}

}

<|endoftext|>/*
xs represent coefficients of a polynomial.
xs{0} + xs{1} * x + xs{2} * x^2 +....
 Return derivative of this polynomial in the same form.
>>> derivative({3, 1, 2, 4, 5})
{1, 4, 12, 20}
>>> derivative({1, 2, 3})
{2, 6}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<float> derivative(vector<float> xs){
    vector<float> ys;
    float sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < xs.size(); i++){
        sum += xs[i] * xs[i];
        ys.push_back(sum);
    }
    return ys;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Write a function that accepts two vectors of strings and returns the vector that has 
total number of chars in the all strings of the vector less than the other vector.

if the two vectors have the same number of chars, return the first vector.

Examples
total_match({}, {})  {}
total_match({"hi", "admin"}, {"hI", "Hi"})  {"hI", "Hi"}
total_match({"hi", "admin"}, {"hi", "hi", "admin", "project"})  {"hi", "admin"}
total_match({"hi", "admin"}, {"hI", "hi", "hi"})  {"hI", "hi", "hi"}
total_match({"4"}, {"1", "2", "3", "4", "5"})  {"4"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> total_match(vector<string> lst1,vector<string> lst2){
    vector<string> result;
    for(auto i=0;i<lst1.size();i++){
        for(auto j=0;j<lst2.size();j++){
            if(lst1[i]==lst2[j]){
                result.push_back(lst1[i]);
            }
        }
    }
    return result;
}

case or all keys are strings in upper case, else return false.
The function should return false is the given map is empty.
Examples:
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"b","banana"}}) should return true.
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"A","banana"}, {"B","banana"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"a","apple"}, {"8","banana"}, {"a","apple"}}) should return false.
check_map_case({{"Name","John"}, {"Age","36"}, {"City","Houston"}}) should return false.

    map<string,string>::iterator it;
    for(it=dict.begin();it!=dict.end();it++){
        if(!(*it).empty()){
            if(!(*it).compare(0,1,"A")){
                return false;
            }
        }
    }
    return true;
}
